title: Question Time audience member SLAMS Owen Smith's call to ban Trump's Parliament address
text:
Question Time audience member SLAMS Owen Smith's call to ban Trump's Parliament address Question Time audience member SLAMS Owen Smith's call to ban Trump's Parliament address A QUESTION Time audience member received rapturous applause after he blasted Owen Smith for suggesting Donald Trump should not be allowed to address Parliament when the US President makes a state visit later this year. PUBLISHED: 05:19, Fri, Feb 10, 2017 | UPDATED: 05:57, Fri, Feb 10, 2017 BBC The audience member (R) recived huge applause after he delivered a withering putdown to Owen Smith 
The debate came after House Speaker John Bercow ignored his position's expectation of political neutrality and told MPs he would not invite Trump to speak in the Commons due to allegations of racism and sexism. 
The audience member said: “I’d just like to say I completely disagree with Owen Smith. Related articles Tory MP DISMISSES SNP Minister's defence of Bercow's anti-Trump remark 
“Regardless of what we think about Donald Trump, at the end of the day he is the President of the most powerful country in the world with whom we we share a special relationship.” 
He even quoted English philosopher John Stuart Mill, adding: “If the whole world minus one were of one opinion and one person were of the country opinion, the whole world would have no more right to silence that one person than that one person would have the right to silence mankind.” BBC Other members of the audience smiled and clapped after well-delivered argument 
Both Ukip Deputy Leader Peter Whittle and Tory MP Claire Perry applauded and told the gentleman his speech was “very impressive”. 
The audience member made the point after Labour MP Owen Smith, who previously said on the show that he thought Brexit “will be a disaster” , told the Question Time audience: “I don’t think Trump should be given the honour of addressing both Houses of Parliament.
